articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Back Home
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Back Home
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and his party flew back home on Saturday after visiting Britain.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop Meets Delegation of 2011 Women's World Cup Organizing Committee
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop Meets Delegation of 2011 Women's World Cup Organizing Committee 
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with the delegation of the Organizing Committee for the 2011 Women's World Cup led by Theo Zwanziger, president of the German Football Association, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Saturday.

articles.title: DPRK, Germany Sign MOU on Cooperation between Football Associations
articles.content:
DPRK, Germany Sign MOU on Cooperation between Football Associations 
						
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- A memorandum of understanding on cooperation between the DPRK Football Association and the German Football Association was signed at the People's Palace of Culture on Saturday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Ri Jong Mu, chairman of the DPRK Football Association, and other officials concerned and from the opposite side the members of the delegation of the Organizing Committee for the 2011 Women's World Cup led by Theo Zwanziger, president of the German Football Association, and German ambassador to the DPRK Gerhard Thiedemann.
					
					 Ri Jong Mu and Theo Zwanziger inked the MOU.

articles.title: DPRK Team's Participation in 2011 Women's World Cup Welcomed
articles.content:
DPRK Team's Participation in 2011 Women's World Cup Welcomed
						
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- An event was held by the delegation of the Organizing Committee for the 2011 Women's World Cup at the People's Palace of Culture Saturday to welcome the DPRK team's participation in the 2011 Women's World Cup.
					 Present there were Ri Jong Mu, chairman of the DPRK Football Association, Ri Yong Chol, vice-department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Jong Hyok, chairman of the DPRK-Germany Friendship Parliamentary Group, Mun Jae Chol, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned and players and coaches to participate in the 2011 Women's World Cup.
					
					 Diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here were present there on invitation.
					
					 Also present there were the delegation of the Organizing Committee for the 2011 Women's World Cup led by Theo Zwanziger, president of the German Football Association, Ambassador Gerhard Thiedemann and staff members of German embassy here.
					
					 Congratulatory speeches were followed by a show of videos on the preparations for the world cup.
					
					 A reception was given.

articles.title: Talks Held between KPA and Lao Defence Ministry Delegations
articles.content:
Talks Held between KPA and Lao Defence Ministry Delegations
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- Talks between a military delegation of the Korean People's Army and a delegation of the Defence Ministry of Laos took place at the Lao Defence Ministry building on March 31.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were the members of the KPA military delegation led by Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and the DPRK ambassador to Laos and from the opposite side the vice-minister of Defence, the deputy chief of the General Staff of the Laotian People's Army and officials concerned.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of boosting friendly relations between the armies of the two countries and on matters of mutual concern.
					
					 The talks proceeded in a friendly atmosphere.

articles.title: Food Festival Held
articles.content:
Food Festival Held
Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- A food festival was held in Pyongyang recently.
					 On display at the festival were many kinds of food, including Pyongyang fare, and national drinks.
					
					 Fried chicken pectoral seasoned with applesauce and steamed carp seasoned with strawberry juice presented by the Mangyongdae District Restaurants Management Office were highly appreciated at the festival for their good taste and colors.
					
					 Mung-bean jelly salad prepared by Kil Yong Hui, a cook of the Pothonggang District Restaurants Management Office, also caught visitors' eyes for its strong national coloring and peculiar cookery.
					
					 The Taedonggang and Mangyongdae District Restaurants Management Offices won the team title and Kwon Yong Ae, a cook of the Tongmun Crossroads Restaurant took the individual title.
					
					 Sin Mun Gil, vice-chairman of the Pyongyang City Committee of the Korean Association of Cooks, told KCNA that some selected dishes are qualified for the 16th April Holiday Food Festival.

articles.title: Pyongyang Art Festival in Preparation
articles.content:
Pyongyang Art Festival in Preparation
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival will take place soon in Pyongyang.
					 The festival will draw many artistes from China, Russia, Ukraine, Bulgaria and some other countries. Korean artistes at home and abroad will also participate in the festival.
					
					 Its preparations are now in full swing.
					
					 The Ryugyong Jong Ju Yong Gymnasium, the venue of the opening ceremony, has been garnished splendidly.
					
					 The Pyongyang Grand Theater, the Moranbong Theater and other theaters in Pyongyang have renewed stage settings and illuminators.
					
					 An opening performance of Korean artistes, friendship gathering and sports and amusement games for the participants are also planned.
					
					 Festival posters have already been issued and diplomas and prizes are ready.
					
					 During the festival, its participants will tour various places of the country.

articles.title: Posters for April Spring Festival Produced
articles.content:
Posters for April Spring Festival Produced
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- Posters were produced to greet the 27th April Spring Friendship Art Festival to be held here on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 They reflect the desires and wishes of the Korean people and other progressives of the world to significantly commemorate the birth anniversary of the President as a holiday common to humankind. 
					
					 A poster depicts Kimilsungia, Kimjongilia and other beautiful flowers and fireworks in the sky in April. It conveys the feelings of the Korean people warmly welcoming the foreign artistes coming to the DPRK with boundless reverence for the peerlessly great persons. 
					
					 Another poster portraying women artistes in diverse folk costumes holding high the logo of the festival fully represents its idea of independence, peace and friendship.
					
					 There are posters depicting a conductor displaying his high artistic skill full of enthusiasm, singers, dancers and acrobats presenting admirable stunts.

articles.title: New Postage Stamps Issued
articles.content:
New Postage Stamps Issued 
						
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK has issued a new sheet and an individual stamp to mark the 50th anniversary of the Pukchong Meeting.
					 President Kim Il Sung convened an enlarged meeting of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea in April Juche 50 (1961) in Pukchong County, South Hamgyong Province. At the meeting, he called for launching a nationwide effort for building orchards throughout the country and developing fruit farming in an extensive way.
					
					 Seen in the sheet is a picture of the President conversing with farmers in an orchard.
					
					 The individual stamp contains a picture of appetizing apples.

articles.title: Spoonbill under Protection
articles.content:
Spoonbill under Protection
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- Spoonbill has been well protected as a national treasure in the DPRK.
					The bird, low in breeding coefficient, is in danger of extinction with only 700-1,000 remaining in the world.
					
					 Korea is a main habitat of the bird. The DPRK government has registered its breeding places as reserves. 
					
					 The country has provided spoonbills with good living conditions including swampy reserves. 
					
					 This year, the government plans to make a survey of all breeding places and confirm the number of the bird in the country.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts US Human Rights Abuses
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts US Human Rights Abuses 
Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- A trial of a U.S. soldier was held at a military court in Washington State recently.
					 This soldier belonging to the 2nd Infantry Division of the U.S. imperialists in Afghanistan was prosecuted for brutally killing inhabitants there and taking thousands of pictures by their dead bodies. 
					
					 When world public circles became increasingly vocal protesting and denouncing the U.S. military for having connived at the murder, it had no alternative but to put him to a trial.
					
					 While staging the trial, the U.S. military was brazen-faced enough to assert that the soldier's crime was a breach of even the U.S. "human rights standard." 
					
					 This was nothing but sophism aimed to whitewash the poor human rights record in the corrupt and ailing American society. The purpose of the trial staged by the U.S. military is, in the final analysis, to create illusion among those who entertain disillusionment and skepticism about the U.S.-style "human rights" and continue fighting an "anti-terror war" for world domination. 
					
					 The U.S. is the world's tundra of human rights as it has no right to talk about human rights. The security of lives of people is wantonly violated and all sorts of crimes are taking place in an unbroken chain in the U.S. even at this hour amid a fierce competition for existence under the sway of the law of the jungle.
					
					 Mass killings of peaceable inhabitants are being perpetrated by the U.S. troops without let-up in different parts of the world under the signboard of "anti-terror war".
					
					 It is a mockery of human justice and conscience and an outright challenge to them for the U.S. to praise its brigandish "human rights standard."
					
					 As for the "human rights standard" touted by the U.S. it is nothing but a brigandish theory of painting a good deed as a crime and vice versa.
					
					 All the human rights abuses by the U.S. are conducted in an organized way according to the instructions and orders of the U.S. administration and the brasshats guided by the above-said shameless theory.
					
					 The U.S. is sadly mistaken if it calculates it can don the veil of "champion of human rights" through such poor trial. 
					
					 Mankind will certainly force the U.S. to face a stern judgment of history as it loves justice and peace and respects genuine human rights.

articles.title: Imperialists' False Propaganda and Psywar Flayed
articles.content:
Imperialists' False Propaganda and Psywar Flayed
Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The world media should see through the sinister aims sought by the U.S. and other imperialists through false propaganda and psywar and not be played into their hands, urges Rodong Sinmun Saturday in a bylined article.
					The unceasing smear campaigns against the socialist countries and anti-imperialist and independent countries are a basic mode of the imperialists' false propaganda and psywar, the article says, and goes on:
					
					The U.S. laid a dense media network worldwide, taking a firm hold on many information means. It even laid down principles guiding its smear campaigns against the above-said countries. Acting upon these rules, the reptile media in the U.S. have consistently conducted false propaganda against those countries while making profound confusion of right and wrong.
					
					It is another mode of the imperialists' false propaganda and psywar to heap praises on the Western world and capitalism.
					
					The U.S. sharply increased entertainment programs for youth in their broadcasting services, keeping in mind the fact that not a small number of them are more interested in pop songs and entertainment than politics. It makes them include stories praising the "advantages" of U.S.-style capitalist system in those programs. Its ulterior intention is to implant U.S.-style "view on value" into the minds of youth in the respective regions before their outlooks on the world are fully shaped.
					
					The another aim sought by the U.S. and other imperialists through their false propaganda and psywar is to bring down all the socialist countries in the world just as what they did in the East European countries and Americanize and Westernize the anti-imperialist and independent countries.
					
					The imperialist forces' false propaganda and psywar is also aimed to justify their moves to stifle the anti-imperialist and independent countries and lay an international siege to those countries.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Demand Stop to Illegal Investigation of Civilians
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Demand Stop to Illegal Investigation of Civilians 
Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The Network for Watching Security Organization held a press conference in Seoul on March 29 denouncing the puppet National Intelligence Service for its illegal investigation of civilians.
					 It is made up of the Bar Association for Democratic Society, the Progressive Network, the Citizens' Solidarity for Democratic Society and the Solidarity for Progress of south Korea. 
					
					The organization accused the NIS of wiretapping any time the Internet and telephone registered in the name of Kim Hyong Gun, teacher affiliated to the Teachers Trade Union of south Korea.
					
					Recalling that the Seoul Central District Court allowed it to commit an illegal wiretapping, the organization declared that this was an infringement upon the elementary freedom and rights of the people. 
					
					 It demanded an immediate stop to the investigation and watch of civilians.
					
					  Then, the organization sent a petition to the Constitutional Court for a trial of the NIS' illegal act.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Group's Planned Suppression of Students Slammed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Group's Planned Suppression of Students Slammed
						
Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- Student organizations including the south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century at a press conference held outside the building of the puppet Police Agency on March 29 denounced the authorities for their reckless suppression of students.
					The speakers at the conference recalled that the present conservative ruling forces' planned investigation of students was disclosed by the case of crackdown upon the economic and academic organization of university students.
					
					 The police shadowed and watched the members of the organization for the past three years and, not content with this, went the lengths of breaking into their houses and ransacking their personal belongings, the speakers condemned.
					
					They urged the police to stop at once the moves to label the students organization an "enemy-benefiting organization" and release the arrested and detained members.

articles.title: Settlement of Issue of Registration Fee Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Settlement of Issue of Registration Fee Urged in S. Korea
						
Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet police authorities are recklessly suppressing the actions of student, civic and public organizations demanding the settlement of the issue of registration fee.
					The National Network for Civic and Public Organizations for Measures for Settling the Issue of Registration Fee worked out a plan to hold a rally of citizens and students at Seoul University road for having the registration fee cut down by half and marched as far as Korea University on April 2. The network groups at least 550 organizations including the south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century, the Citizen's Solidarity for Democratic Society and the Society of Parents of Students for Genuine Education. 
					
					But the puppet police authorities turned down the application for the above-said rally on March 11 under the pretext of the issue of main road and traffic jam and took the same stand on March 30. 
					
					 The organization declared that it would carry on its actions till its demands are met, noting that the precondition put up by the police was nothing but a pretext for blocking the above-said actions.

articles.title: S. Korean Political Camp in Chaos
articles.content:
S. Korean Political Camp in Chaos 
   Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities recently cancelled the project to build a "new airport in the southeastern area," the south Korean KBS and MBC said, adding that the political camp is in chaos and the anti-"government" sentiment is mounting following the cancellation of the  decision.
					The proposed construction of the airport was one of the typical commitments made by Lee Myung Bak during his "presidential" election in a bid to elicit the mind-set of the people in the Ryongnam area. 
					
					 The authorities, however, failed to choose even the site of the airport though three years have passed since they came to power. On March 30, they made public the decision to nullify the project.
					
					 They had long argued about as to where to build the airport: Milyang in South Kyongsang Province or Kadok Island in Pusan.
					
					 The mayor of Pusan clarified that he could not admit the "government's" decision while the mayor of Taegu demanded Lee Myung Bak apologize for deceiving people.
					
					The inhabitants in the Ryongnam area denounced the authorities for fostering conflict between areas, urging the "government" to take immediate measures. 
					
					Civic organizations clarified that they would conduct not only actions for denouncing the present "government" but a massive campaign for defeating candidates from the "Grand National Party" in the by-election of "National Assemblymen" due on April 27.
					
					"National Assemblymen" from the GNP in the Ryongnam area said they could hardly repress their indignation at the wrong decision made by the authorities.
					
					They demanded in group Lee Myung Bak make an apology, the party leadership step down and Chongwadae reorganize itself.
					
					The Democratic Party denounced the present authorities for pressing for the project for improving the four big rivers while throwing away their election commitments like a pair of old shoes.

articles.title: Graduation Ceremony of Korean Students in Japan Held
articles.content:
Graduation Ceremony of Korean Students in Japan Held
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- A graduation ceremony took place on Mar. 27 at Tohoku Korean Primary and Middle School amid warm wishes by the Koreans' community. The school was also severely damaged by earthquake and tsunami that hit Japan.
					 Present there were members of the Emergency Measure Committee of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, delegates of measure committees of different headquarters and Koreans in Tohoku. 
					
					 Read out there was a message from Pyongyang Tonghung Secondary School, friendship school in homeland.
					
					 A report was made to be followed by speeches of graduates. 
					
					 Speakers said that they have become to graduate from the school amid best wishes by the Koreans' community despite the difficult situation where the people have not yet recovered from quake and tsunami damage. 
					
					 They resolved to become able persons who would shoulder the future of the Koreans' community by overcoming difficulties and ordeals ahead of them.

articles.title: Nigerian National Seminar on President Kim Il Sung's Feats Held
articles.content:
Nigerian National Seminar on President Kim Il Sung's Feats Held
						
Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- A Nigerian national seminar on the feats performed by President Kim Il Sung took place at Nasarawa University on March 23 on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					Displayed in the venue of the seminar were works of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, photos showing his feats, books and photos introducing Songun Korea.
					
					M. M. Alhassan, chairman of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, said in a keynote report that the President founded the Juche idea, ushered in an era of independence, defeated two imperialisms in one generation, built a socialist power independent in politics,  self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defense and devoted his whole life to the happiness of the people.
					
					A professor of the Political Faculty of University of Abuja said at the seminar that the President believed in the inexhaustible strength of the popular masses and believed in the people as in Heaven, adding that the President was the tender-hearted father of the people.
					
					 A professor at the International Journalist University said that the DPRK has vigorously accelerated the building of an economic power despite the sanctions and blockade of the imperialist forces led by the U.S. and severe natural disasters, adding that this was something marvelous the secret of which was the embodiment of the Juche idea.
					
					Abdullahi Muhammad Yamma, chairman of the Nigerian Group for Self-Reliance Studies, said that Kim Jong Il has built the Korean People's Army into an elite invincible army.
					
					A letter to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Letter to Kim Jong Il from Participants in Nigerian National Seminar
articles.content:
Letter to Kim Jong Il from Participants in Nigerian National Seminar 
						
Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a letter from the participants in the Nigerian national seminar on the feats of President Kim Il Sung, the father of socialist Korea, on March 23 on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					The letter noted that the President waged the anti-Japanese armed struggle under the uplifted banner of the Juche idea, liberated the country from the military occupation by the Japanese imperialists and founded the DPRK, the first people's democratic state in the East.
					
					The feats the President performed by establishing the socialist system centered on the popular masses guided by his original idea of nation-building and with his experienced and tested leadership always remain shining, the letter noted, and went on:
					
					Kim Jong Il has held aloft the banner of the Juche idea and the Songun idea true to the cause of the President, turning the DPRK into a political and ideological power to be reckoned with on the international arena. 
					
					The participants said in the letter that the seminar provided them with an opportunity to know better about the feats performed by the President who built socialist Korea and the Songun revolutionary feats performed by Kim Jong Il on the road of building a thriving socialist nation. 
					
					 They renewed their resolution to strive hard to widely study and disseminate the Juche idea and the Songun idea.

articles.title: Finnish Organization Opens Internet Website for Jongilbong E-library
articles.content:
Finnish Organization Opens Internet Website for Jongilbong E-library
						
Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- A Finnish Mangyongdae committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung opened an Internet website for Jongilbong E-library on March 26 on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					The first page of website has a picture of the three commanders of Mt. Paektu.
					
					Posted there are works of the President and General Secretary Kim Jong Il in a chorological order and the brief history of the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Suk, an anti-Japanese war hero.
					
					The website in its introduction expressed hope that the inauguration of the E-library would help the Finnish people have a more proper understanding of the Juche idea, the political philosophy of the President and Kim Jong Il, and their leadership mode and the economy and culture of the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by British Organization
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by British Organization
Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy posted on its Internet homepage a portrait of smiling President Kim Il Sung and photos on his revolutionary activities and an article titled "Eternal Sun of Mankind" on the occasion of his birth anniversary. 
					The President, perfectly possessed of personality and qualifications as a great man, paved the way for carving out the destiny of the Korean nation with his distinguished revolutionary idea and through his energetic practical activities, the article noted, adding that he is the eternal sun of mankind who made a great contribution to global independence. 
					
					The progressive mankind is boundlessly revering the President, it noted, and went on:
					
					The President put forward an original idea of accomplishing the cause of independence and performed immortal feats to go down in the world history through his energetic activities.
					
					The President was not only a rare thinker and theoretician, prominent statesman and outstanding strategist but also a peerlessly great man with noble virtue and traits.
					
					Kim Il Sung, the outstanding great man produced by the 20th century, will always live as the sun thanks to the boundless reverence of all people.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary to Be Commemorated
  Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The Russian and Bangladeshi papers edited special write-ups on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					The Russian paper Vladivostok carried an article with the beaming image of the President on March 25.
					
					The article went on:
					
					 Kim Il Sung, the father of socialist Korea, was the popular leader, indeed.
					
					Believing in the people as in Heaven was motto which the President held fast to all his life from the very day he embarked on the road of the struggle for the country and the people. 
					
					 The President founded the Juche idea in the early period of his revolutionary activities and put forward the Juche-oriented line of the Korean revolution based on it.
					
					The Korean people defeated the U.S. imperialists in the Fatherland Liberation War for the first time in history, carried out the historic task of industrialization in a matter of 14 years and converted the country into a socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence. These were the miracles the President wrought by giving full play to the inexhaustible strength of the popular masses.
					
					The President was the tender-hearted father of the people.
					
					The Korean people boundlessly revere the President, always remembering him.
					
					The Bangladeshi paper Natun Bangla on March 28 devoted one whole page to a portrait of the President and several articles under the banner-line title "President Kim Il Sung, the great man of the century."

articles.title: Thailand Burns away Sweet Potatoes from Japan
articles.content:
Thailand Burns away Sweet Potatoes from Japan
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- Thailand recently burned away all sweet potatoes it imported from Japan. 
					 This measure was taken following the detection of radioactive materials in the sweet potatoes.

articles.title: Quake Hits Indonesia
articles.content:
Quake Hits Indonesia 
Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 5.1- magnitude struck off North Sulawesi in eastern parts of Indonesia on Monday.
					The epicenter was at 72 km southeast Melonguane.

articles.title: Preparations for Winter Olympic Games in Russia
articles.content:
Preparations for Winter Olympic Games in Russia
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- Russia has made preparations for the Winter Olympic Games to be held in Sochi in 2014.
					 The country is building new sports facilities, including a gymnasium where the opening ceremony will be held, roads, railways, airports, hotels and Olympic Park.
					
					 Much effort has been directed to improving traffic networks.
					
					 A modern airport was built in Sochi.
					
					 Its hourly traffic capacity is some 1,600 people now but it will be about 4,000 people in 2014.
					
					 Russia plans to sponsor international tournaments at already built facilities before the Olympic Games to gain experience necessary for the world festival.

articles.title: Russian President Appreciates Anti-Terror Operations of Special Organs
articles.content:
Russian President Appreciates Anti-Terror Operations of Special Organs
						
 Moscow, March 31 (KCNA) -- Dmitri Medvedev, president of Russia, at talks on March 29, highly appreciated the anti-terror operations conducted by the Russian special organs in the Republic of Ingushetiya.
					 The organs taught serious lessons to the insurgents, in cooperation with other state organs, and defended the country, he said.
					
					 Steps for cleaning up the insurgents should be kept on since there are still difficult problems in some areas, he said, expressing the stand to continue this work to the end.

articles.title: Work for Preventing Wheat from Harmful Insects Called for in China
articles.content:
Work for Preventing Wheat from Harmful Insects Called for in China
						
 Beijing, March 31 (KCNA) -- The Chinese Ministry of Agriculture at a national meeting for preventing wheat from harmful insects in Shiyan City, Hubei Province on March 29 called for dynamically conduct the work. 
					 The meeting informed the participants that due to the long-drawn drought this year new harmful insects have appeared in fields under wheat, doing harm to the crop, and called on the farmers in various areas to intensify the work to prevent wheat from harmful insects, its observation and forecasting in a bid to reduce wheat loss as much as possible.

articles.title: Afforestation Called for in China
articles.content:
Afforestation Called for in China
						
 Beijing, March 31 (KCNA) -- Hui Liangyu, vice-premier of the State Council of China, called for dynamic afforestation movement at the plenary meeting of the committee held here on March 29.
					 Saying that planting trees across the country is a strategic requirement for ecological civilization drive, he underscored the need to intensify the guidance over afforestation in different areas and fields, actively combat reckless deforestation and prevent forest fire. 
					
					 He urged all the people to be aware of the importance and urgency of the afforestation and actively participate in the all-people compulsory tree-planting activities.

articles.title: Ahmadinejad Calls on World Nations to Unite against Bullying Powers
articles.content:
Ahmadinejad Calls on World Nations to Unite against Bullying Powers
						
 Teheran, March 31 (KCNA) -- Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad blasted the attempts made by the arrogant and colonialist powers against the other countries and urged the world nations to become united against the bullying powers. 
					 President Ahmadinejad made the remark in a meeting with Lebanese caretaker Foreign Minister Ali al-Shami in Tehran on Monday. He condemned the hegemonic forces for putting pressure upon those countries opposed to the wrong policy of the West and protecting Zionism.
					
					He also reiterated that independent states by adopting rational stands can thwart plots of their enemies.

articles.title: Ecuador Expresses Stand to Strengthen Regional Trade
articles.content:
Ecuador Expresses Stand to Strengthen Regional Trade
 Pyongyang, April 2 (KCNA) -- The Ecuadorian minister for Economic Policy Coordination expressed the stand of his country to strengthen regional trade in his recent interview with Prensa Latina. 
					 Ecuador aims to look to the South and to its neighbors to diversify its markets and consolidate regional trade, the minister said, adding:
					
					 We believe we can rely a lot on the development of trade among South American countries, and the conditions exist to increase our exports based on agreements currently in force.

articles.title: Yang Hyong Sop se reune con delegacion alemana
articles.content:
Yang Hyong Sop se reune con delegacion alemana
Pyongyang, 2 de abril (ATCC) -- El vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Yang Hyong Sop, departio el dia 2 en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae con la delegacion del comite organizador de la Copa Mundial (F) de 2011 encabezada por el presidente de la Asociacion de Futbol de la Republica Federal de Alemania, Theo Zwanziger.

articles.title: Rubricada nota de entendimiento entre asociaciones de Futbol de Corea y Alemania
articles.content:
Rubricada nota de entendimiento entre asociaciones de Futbol de Corea y Alemania
						
Pyongyang, 2 de abril (ATCC) -- Quedo rubricada este sabado en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo la nota de entendimiento sobre la cooperacion entre la Asociacion de Futbol de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la de la Republica Federal de Alemania.
					En la ceremonia de firmas estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana el presidente de la asociacion, Ri Jong Mu, y otros funcionarios, y por la alemana, los miembros de la delegacion del comite organizador de la Copa Mundial (F) de 2011 encabezada por el presidente de la asociacion alemana Theo   Zwanziger, y el embajador aleman en Corea Gerhard Thiedemann.
					
					Ri Jong Mu y Theo Zwanziger firmaron el documento.

articles.title: Celebran la participacion de RPDC en copa mundial (f)
articles.content:
Celebran la participacion de RPDC en copa mundial (f)
						
Pyongyang, 2 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 2 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el acto congratulatorio de la participacion del equipo coreano en la Copa Mundial de 2011 (F) ofrecido por la delegacion del comite organizador de la Copa Mundial (F) de 2011.
					A la ocasion fueron invitados Ri Jong Mu, presidente de la Asociacion de Futbol de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Yong Chol, subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Ri Jong Hyok, presidente del grupo de parlamentarios de amistad Corea-Alemania, Mun Jae Chol, vicepresidente del Comite Coreano de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero y otros funcionarios, las futbolistas y entrenadores que participaran en la copa mundial, y los representantes diplomaticos de varios paises y delegados de organizaciones internacionales, acreditados en la RPDC.
					
					Ademas, figuraban la delegacion del comite organizador de la Copa Mundial encabezada por el presidente de la Asociacion de Futbol de Alemania, Theo Zwanziger, el embajador Gerhard Thiedemann y otros miembros de la embajada alemana en Corea.
					
					Luego de escuchar las palabras de felicitacion, los participantes vieron los videos sobre los preparativos de esa cita deportiva.
					
					A continuacion, se ofrecio un banquete.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre delegaciones militares de Corea y Laos
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre delegaciones militares de Corea y Laos
						
Pyongyang, 2 de abril (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el 31 de marzo las conversaciones entre la delegacion militar del Ejercito Popular de Corea y la del Ministerio de Defensa de Laos en la sede de esta cartera.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes, por la parte coreana, los miembros de la delegacion militar del EPC encabezada por Pak Jae Gyong, viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, y el embajador coreano en Laos y, por la laosiana, el viceministro de Defensa, el subjefe del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular Lao y otros funcionarios.
					
					  Ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el problema de desarrollar las relaciones de amistad entre los ejercitos de los dos paises y otros de interes mutuo.
					
					Las conversaciones trascurrieron en un clima amistoso.

articles.title: ?Quien debe sentarse en el banquillo de acusados? - comentario de ATCC
articles.content:
?Quien debe sentarse en el banquillo de acusados? - comentario de ATCC 
						
Pyongyang, 2 de abril (ATCC) -- Hace poco, se realizo en un tribunal militar del Estado de Washington, Estados Unidos, la pesquisa sobre un soldado de la division de infanteria no. 2 estacionada en Afganistan, que fue acusado por haber asesinado cruelmente a los afganos y tomado miles de fotografias de recuerdo al lado de cadaveres.
					Es que la capa militar norteamericana, que toleraba las atrocidades de sus efectivos, no pudo ignorar esta vez las protestas y denuncias cada dia mas crecientes de la sociedad internacional.
					
					En ese juicio, la capa militar norteamericana dijo que los crimenes del acusado contravienen tambien a la "norma de DDHH" del pais. Esto es una sofisteria para disimular la situacion de DDHH de la sociedad norteamericana corrupta.
					
					Pues, ese proceso es una farsa para convencer a los que estan decepcionados de los "DDHH" al estilo norteamericano, y continuar la "guerra antiterrorista" encaminada a tomar la hegemonia mundial.
					
					EE.UU. es el pais infernal para DDHH que no tiene derecho a hablar de este tema.
					
					En estos momentos tambien, en la sociedad estadounidense, donde reina la ley de la selva, se violan despiadadamente la seguridad y la vida de seres humanos en la voragine de la lucha por subsistencia que acompana los delitos de toda clase.
					
					Por doquier del mundo se cometen incesantemente las masacres de civiles pacificos por parte de uniformados norteamericanos bajo el rotulo de "guerra antiterrorista".
					
					Sin embargo, el imperio alaba su "pauta de DDHH" burlandose y desafiando frontalmente a la justicia y conciencia de la humanidad.
					
					La "pauta de DDHH", de que habla el imperio, es una doctrina gangsteril que convierte en un instante la maldad en la bondad.
					
					Todos los actos de violacion de DDHH de EE.UU. se cometen con tal cinismo y de modo organizado a las ordenes de la administracion norteamericana y la cupula militar.
					
					Estaria muy equivocado EE.UU., reino de violacion de DDHH, si piensa que podria disfrazarse de "defensor de DDHH" abriendo el juicio tan hipocrita como el mencionado arriba.
					
					La humanidad que ama la paz y la justicia y aprecia verdaderos derechos humanos sometera sin falta a EE.UU. a la severa sentencia de la historia.
